overview: Darjeeling is a hill station in northern West Bengal, India, famous for its Victorian heritage, tea plantations, cultural diversity of Tibetan and Nepali communities, and as a gateway to Sikkim.
bestTimeToVisit: October to June (avoiding the monsoon months of July‑September)
topAttractions: Darjeeling Himalayan Railway (UNESCO World Heritage Site)
Cultural sites of Tibetan and Nepali communities
travelTips: Check for any Gorkhaland strikes or protests before traveling.
Use shared terrain vehicles or taxis from Siliguri; fare is ₹150‑200 per person.
Luggage can be carried on the roof of vehicles for free.
Carry sufficient cash; credit‑card acceptance is limited.
English, Hindi, and Nepali are widely understood.
Acclimatise to the altitude and stay hydrated.
Book budget accommodation in advance during peak season.
